techmeme.title: Duolingo plans to add a chess course, which uses short puzzles to help learn the game, in beta on iOS in English in the coming weeks before an Android launch (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Sources: the US plans to push India to give Amazon, Walmart, and other US online retailers full access to its $125B e-commerce market, as part of tariff talks (Financial Times)
Google rolls out opt-in Sensitive Content Warnings in Messages to blur nude images on Android; the System SafetyCore-powered content classification is on-device (Abner Li/9to5Google)
DOJ v. Google: a Google VP says the company pays Samsung an "enormous sum of money" every month to preinstall Gemini on its devices as part of a two-year deal (Leah Nylen/Bloomberg)
Flipkart plans to shift its holding company from Singapore to India as Walmart aims to take it public; Flipkart moved the entity to Singapore in 2011 (Kashish Tandon/Reuters)
